intro: Blepharis inopinata, commonly known as the narrowleaf blepharis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features slender, upright stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are small, tubular, and usually pink or purple in color, appearing in clusters. It is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
